title: Automated clinical documentation system and method
abstract: A method, computer program product, and computing system for proactive encounter scanning is executed on a computing device and includes obtaining encounter information of a patient encounter. The encounter information is proactively processed to determine if the encounter information is indicative of one or more medical conditions and to generate one or more result set. The one or more result sets are provided to the user.
claims:
1. A computer-implemented method for proactive encounter scanning, executed on a computing device, comprising:
obtaining encounter information of a patient encounter, wherein the encounter information includes audio encounter information obtained from a first automated clinical documentation (ACD) client electronic device in a physical monitored space and machine vision encounter information obtained from a second ACD client electronic device in the physical monitored space;
utilizing a virtual assistant in the physical monitored space to audibly prompt a patient to provide at least a portion of the audio encounter information from the first ACD client electronic device and the machine vision encounter information from the second ACD client electronic device associated with the audio encounter information during the patient encounter and utilizing the virtual assistant in the physical monitored space to audibly prompt the patient to provide at least a second portion of the audio encounter information from the first ACD client electronic device and the machine vision encounter information from the second ACD client electronic device associated with the audio encounter information during the patient encounter;
processing the audio encounter information and the machine vision encounter information to determine if the audio encounter information and the machine vision encounter information is indicative of one or more medical conditions and to generate one or more result sets, wherein processing the audio encounter information and the machine vision encounter information includes documenting and identifying one or more portions of the audio encounter information and the machine vision encounter information respectively that concern the one or more medical conditions, thus defining one or more condition-related encounter portions, and filtering the audio encounter information and the machine vision encounter information to emphasize the one or more condition-related encounter portions;
providing the one or more result sets to a user, wherein providing the one or more result sets to the user includes rendering a visual representation of the one or more result sets including the one or more condition-related encounter portions as documented and emphasized that are indicative of the one or more medical conditions, wherein the one or more condition-related encounter portions is less than the one or more result sets in their entirety; and
initiating an inquiry concerning the one or more medical conditions by providing a notification to a medical professional.
2. The computer-implemented method of claim 1 wherein the one or more result sets includes:
a first result set indicative of a first medical condition; and
at least a second result set indicative of at least a second medical condition.
3. The computer-implemented method of claim 1 wherein at least one of the first and second ACD client electronic devices is configured to steer a beam towards the patient in the physical monitored space.
4. The computer-implemented method of claim 1 wherein the virtual assistant is utilized in a check-in area of the physical monitored space during a pre-visit portion of the patient encounter.
5. The computer-implemented method of claim 1 wherein the virtual assistant is utilized in a check-out area of the physical monitored space during a post-visit portion of the patient encounter.
6. The computer-implemented method of claim 1 wherein providing the one or more result sets to the user includes:
rendering an audible representation of the one or more result sets for the user.
7. The computer-implemented method of claim 1 further comprising processing the audio encounter information and the machine vision encounter information to determine if at least one of the audio encounter information and the machine vision encounter information is indicative of one or more potential medical situations, wherein the one or more potential medical situations includes one or more of:
a potential medication issue;
a potential home healthcare issue; and
a potential follow-up issue.
